_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Facility Accidental Release Policy

The owners, management, and emloyees of Environmental Technologies Inc facility at 379 E. 300 S., Jerome

Idaho are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of stored formaldehyde. If an accidental

release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, or other authorities to

mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.



2. Facility Information

The primary activity at the Jerome facility is the storage of the formaldehyde solution.

The regulated substance, 37% formaldehyde liquid solution, will be stored in above ground storage tanks and

transfered to DOT regulated transportation vehicles for delivery to customers. The maximum quantity

of formaldehyde stored at the Jerome location is 31,000 gallons which is stored in 5 seperate above ground

storage tanks within a containment area.



This location has standard operating procedures in place, an inspection and maintenance program, employee

training and a completed risk analysis. The risk associated with product transfer and storage is deemed low

compared to chemical processing locations. 



Since the covered process is restricted to the storage of the product there are no full time employees

associated directly with this location. However, there are 2 full time employees who work for the location

and assume other duties related to the transporation of the product to customers. As such, their part time

availability at the location will be indicated as 1 full time employee for the site. The storage process is located

on the tenents property.



3. Accidental Release Prevention Program

The facility has implemented a quarterly documented inspection program of all tank and associated piping.

In addition, a visual inspection is conducted each time personnel are present at the storage location.

Inspection checklist is utilized for the quarterly inspections and a list of items to

visually inspect during each

visit is also available. Maintenance is performed according to manufacturer recommendations and is

available as an SOP. 



4. Five-Year Accident History

There have been no accidental releases or near misses of Formaldehyde in the past five years that:

have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor

have resulted in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental

damage.



5. The Emergency Response Program

This location will be a non-responding facility. Coordination with the LEPC is in place.



Allowable actions for employees include the following:

"responses to incidental releases of hazardous substances where the substance can be absorbed, neutralized,

or otherwise controlled at the time of release by employees in the immediate release area, or by

maintenance personnel"

"responses to releases of hazardous substances where there is no potential safety or health hazard (i.e., fire,

explosion, or chemical exposure)."

The location will utilize services, as required, by Clean Harbors Inc. for spill clean-up and response and/or

other qualified contractors.



6. Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Safety improvement is an on-going process at the storage location. We will continue to evaluate new technlogy and storage practices to solidify our commitment to safety. Employee and public safety is the first priority.
